input_text:
Job Title: Marketing Analytics Specialist

Location: United States

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Analyst, Marketing

Description:
This position is responsible for collaborating with various channels within Marketing along with the Marketing Analytics team to report on the performance of advertising placements relating to print and digital ads. The Marketing Analytics Specialist will need to analyze trends in advertising performance metrics to identify which ad placements are working well and why, as well as what can be improved upon. The Marketing Analytics Specialist will work closely with leadership and management to understand what is needed and provide consistent updates on the progress of work being completed.
KEY RESPONSIBILITIES: Partner with Marketing Analytics team and leadership to create easy-to-understand dashboards, tracking spreadsheets, and presentations that bring forward data-driven insights and revenue attribution reports.Tracking campaign and channel level performance by cohesively analyzing data from various internal and external databases.Identify trends and marketing insights from data and communicate with project shareholders in a clear and concise manner.Create the department’s monthly Google Analytics performance report on all digital advertising.Manage dashboards to be presented to key and strategic supplier partners on a monthly and quarterly basis. Utilize the feedback provided to make edits and adjustments to dashboards as requested.Analyze trends in advertising performance metrics to identify which ad placements in each supplier’s marketing plan are working best, why, and tactics that can be improved upon. Recommendations will be needed on a monthly, quarterly, and annual basis for all advertising vehicles.Creates adhoc reports, monthly reporting and works on special projects on an as needed basis.Identify the optimal audience for different digital marketing initiatives by analyzing customer intelligence.
SPECIFIC KNOWLEDGE & SKILLS:Preferred work experience in data-driven marketing strategy and planning.Highly skilled in Marketo and Salesforce.High proficiency in PowerBI and Excel is requiredGoogle Analytics Certification is requiredStrong organizational and analytical skillsStrong marketing acumen, experience in e-commerce or medical supplies is highly preferredHighly effective communicator
GENERAL SKILLS & COMPETENCIES: Basic understanding of industry practicesGeneral proficiency with tools, systems, and proceduresBasic planning/organizational skills and techniquesGood decision making, analysis and problem solving skillsGood verbal and written communication skillsBasic presentation and public speaking skillsBasic interpersonal skillsDeveloping professional credibility
MINIMUM WORK EXPERIENCE: Typically 2 to 4 years of related professional experience.
PREFERRED EDUCATION: Typically a Bachelor's Degree or global equivalent in related discipline.
TRAVEL / PHYSICAL DEMANDS:Travel typically less than 10%. Office environment. No special physical demands required.
The posted range for this position is $45,000-$95,445 which is the expected starting base salary range for an employee who is new to the role to fully proficient in the role. Many factors go into determining employee pay within the posted range including prior experience, current skills, location/labor market, internal equity, etc.This position is eligible for a bonus not reflected in the posted range.Other benefits available include: Medical, Dental and Vision Coverage, 401K Plan with Company Match, Time off, Paid Parental Leave, Income Protection, Work Life Assistance Program, Flexible Spending Accounts, Educational Benefits, Worldwide Scholarship Program and Volunteer Opportunities.
Henry Schein, Inc. is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate against applicants or employees on the basis of race, color, religion, creed, national origin, ancestry, disability that can be reasonably accommodated without undue hardship, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, citizenship, marital or veteran status, or any other legally protected status. 
For more information about career opportunities at Henry Schein, please visit our website at: www.henryschein.com/careers

Experience Level (if available): Associate

output_json.title: Marketing Analytics Specialist
output_json.summary: Responsible for collaborating with Marketing channels and the Analytics team to report on advertising performance.

Tracking campaign and channel level performance by cohesively analyzing data from various internal and external databases.
Identify trends and marketing insights from data and communicate with project shareholders.
Create the department’s monthly Google Analytics performance report on all digital advertising.
Manage dashboards to be presented to key and strategic supplier partners.
Analyze trends in advertising performance metrics to identify ad placements working best and improvement tactics.
Create adhoc reports, monthly reporting, and work on special projects.
Identify the optimal audience for different digital marketing initiatives.
